title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 October 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <polx> has quit  
00:17 <technickal\_nick> has joined #xwiki  
00:23 <technickal\_nick> Hello, I was wondering if anyone has seen this before: "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro"  
00:24 <technickal\_nick> and if so, if anyone has any suggestions about how to fix it...  
00:24 <technickal\_nick> The full stack trace is here: http://pastebin.com/9xbLvkYU  
00:27 <@cjd> the interesting part is here  
00:27 <@cjd> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Lexical error: org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.TokenMgrError: Lexical error at line 1, column 97.  Encountered: <EOF> after : ""  
00:28 <@cjd> looks like you have 1 too many { and not enough }  
00:28 <@cjd> just a guess  
00:28 <@cjd> usually when the parser reaches the end of the document hoping to parse something else, it's a brackets issue  
00:28 <@cjd> or perhaps you're short an #end tag  
00:29 <technickal\_nick> Thanks cjd...  How would be the best way to edit the offending document? (sorry, I'm not an XWiki user and I guess it's not obvious to me)  
00:30 <@cjd> should be an edit button in the upper left  
00:30 <@cjd> or just rename the url from /bin/view/Your/Document to  /bin/edit/Your/Document?editor=wiki  
00:32 <technickal\_nick> It's actually and extension and it looks like that may be different...  Can I give you the path I use to get to the error?  
00:32 <technickal\_nick> I go to the main wiki page  
00:32 <@cjd> ok  
00:32 <technickal\_nick> Click on the "Reader" "space"  
00:32 <technickal\_nick> I choose "Administer Space"  
00:33 <@cjd> oh, that's not very helpful, the URL might give me a clue  
00:33 <technickal\_nick> And then in the bottom left there is a "Applications -->  Reader" menu/link  
00:33 <technickal\_nick> oh, cool, here it is: http://xwiki-25648-tonyduck2.app.standingcloud.com/xwiki/bin/admin/Reader/WebPreferences?editor=spaceadmin&space=Reader&section=Reader  
00:36 <@cjd> mm hard to say... the piece of code which is failing looks ok, maybe something in WebPreferences was altered at some point  
00:37 <@cjd> perhaps check the activity stream for changes to internal documents  
00:38 <technickal\_nick> Could it be related to the site starting out on an unstable version?  The site was started on milestone 4.2 milestone 1 and then later upgraded to 4.2 stable (after this extension was already installed)...  
00:40 <@cjd> usually anything that serious is caught in an automated test but upgrading tends to be painful and extensions are still pretty new  
00:41 <technickal\_nick> okay, thank you, I will look at the activity stream as you suggested and go from there  
00:41 <technickal\_nick> thanks again for your help, have a good day/night :-)  
00:43 <@cjd> you too  
00:43 <@cjd> best of luck  
00:55 <technickal\_nick> has quit

13:43 <crocket> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <crocket> hi  
13:43 <crocket> Is xwiki better than mediawiki?  
13:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <polx> has quit  
13:54 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
13:55 <tmortagne> crocket: you expect getting objective answer here ? :)  
13:56 <crocket> tmortagne, I'm using mediawiki, and I don't like the fact that it doesn't support per-page ACL.  
13:56 <tmortagne> if you have precise question like this we can answer, in that case XWiki support page based ACL yes  
13:58 <crocket> tmortagne, Can you provide me with an example of a website using XWiki?  
13:59 <tmortagne> crocket: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/  
13:59 <tmortagne> you have a lot there  
13:59 <tmortagne> note that XWiki is much more than a wiki  
13:59 <tmortagne> it's also a development platform  
13:59 <tmortagne> so you can do pretty much anything with it  
14:00 <crocket> tmortagne, Does XWiki display using only JSP?  
14:00 <tmortagne> we generally don't use JSP  
14:00 <tmortagne> we use mostly Velocity  
14:01 <crocket> Velocity?  
14:01 <tmortagne> but you can also use Groovy, Python, Ruby, etc...  
14:01 <crocket> never heard of it  
14:01 <tmortagne> Velocity is a templating language  
14:01 <tmortagne> a very simple language  
14:01 <crocket> tmortagne, XWiki doesn't seem to have a definite shape.  
14:01 <tmortagne> you have a default skin  
14:02 <tmortagne> but you can completely change it  
14:02 <crocket> tmortagne, I mean the UI.  
14:02 <tmortagne> the default skin is pretty much what you have on xwiki.org itself  
14:02 <tmortagne> I know what you mean :)  
14:02 <tmortagne> in what we call a "skin" in XWiki you can modify the whole UI  
14:03 <tmortagne> crocket: a good thing to start testing XWiki is to download the all in one hsqldb/jetty package  
14:04 <crocket> tmortagne, hsqldb?  
14:04 <tmortagne> it's a embedded database  
14:04 <tmortagne> http://hsqldb.org/  
14:05 <tmortagne> we usually use MySQL in production but XWiki works with variouus databases  
14:07 <jvelo> has quit  
14:07 <crocket> tmortagne, Does XWiki use Velocity to render pages?  
14:07 <tmortagne> crocket: yes  
14:08 <tmortagne> well mostly  
14:08 <tmortagne> but in a page you can use various other scripting languages  
14:10 <crocket> tmortagne, "The built-in search of mediawiki looks up pages by name."  
14:10 <crocket> Does XWiki do it, too?  
14:11 <tmortagne> the default search search everywhere (page name, page content, attachments, etc.)  
14:11 <crocket> how about email address encryption?  
14:12 <tmortagne> what do you mean ?  
14:12 <tmortagne> by default in a user profile the email address does not shows up complete  
14:13 <tmortagne> so it can't be used by a robot if that's your question  
14:13 <tmortagne> but the user profile like everything can be  customized  
14:14 <crocket> tmortagne, robots  
14:38 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <crocket> tmortagne, Which execution environment do you recommend?  
14:40 <tmortagne> we usually use Tomcat  
14:40 <tmortagne> if you plan to install it on a Debian based system you should look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT  
15:25 <crocket> hmm

16:18 <crocket> has left #xwiki  
16:55 <coud5> hi, does someone use SVN Application extension ? I installed and configured the extension (followed http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/SVN+Application) but when I click on "List pages to commit" or "Custom List of pages" the it does nothing (page starts loading but no result is shown).  
16:56 <coud5> no error or exception is written to the console  
17:02 <evalica> has quit  
17:07 <sburjan> has quit  
17:13 <Denis> has quit  
17:18 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: hi, since you've looked at wikimodel, I have a question for you  
17:26 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: Hi  
17:26 <vmassol> it seems to me there's something completely wrong in MediawikiScanner.jj which I really can't understand:  
17:26 <vmassol>     | <#VERBATIM\_INLINE: (  
17:26 <vmassol>           "<math>" ( "\\" ~[] | ~[] )\* "</math>"  
17:26 <vmassol>         ) >  
17:26 <vmassol> do you agree it's completely wrong? :)  
17:27 <vmassol> http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Math  
17:28 <AndreasJonsson> Yes, matching ~[] is always problematic.  
17:28 <vmassol> I mean usingf <math>  
17:28 <vmassol> for verbatim  
17:28 <vmassol> maybe mikhail used it since there doesn't seem to be any notion of inline verabtim in mediawiki  
17:29 <AndreasJonsson> Yes, not sure what the thought is with that...  
17:30 <AndreasJonsson> Seems to be some sort of kludge...  
17:30 <vmassol> without any comment…. nice...  
17:32 <AndreasJonsson> But this pattern is also problematic: ( "\\" ~[] | ~[] )\*  
17:36 <vmassol> found http://code.google.com/p/wikimodel/source/browse/trunk/org.wikimodel.wem/REFERENCES.txt  
17:36 <vmassol> but it just says "<math> tags are reported as inline verbatim elements."  
17:39 <AndreasJonsson> So, its just a kludge to display the contents of math tags as verbatim text.  
17:40 <AndreasJonsson> But the longest possible pattern match will be the one taken.  So, there can only be one math-tag on the page. :)  
17:40 <mflorea> has quit  
17:42 <vmassol> :)
